body:
### Describe the bug

Crash:
```
cython_setup.py build_ext --inplace 
Compiling assimilation\formats.pyx because it changed.
[1/1] Cythonizing assimilation\formats.pyx

Error compiling Cython file:
------------------------------------------------------------
...

import dataclasses


dataclass_args = {"order": True, "slots": True, "unsafe_hash": True}
@dataclasses.dataclass(**dataclass_args)
^
------------------------------------------------------------

assimilation\formats.pyx:7:0: Compiler crash in AnalyseDeclarationsTransform

File 'ModuleNode.py', line 207, in analyse_declarations: ModuleNode(formats.pyx:1:0,
    full_module_name = 'assimilation.formats')
File 'Nodes.py', line 405, in analyse_declarations: StatListNode(formats.pyx:1:0)
File 'Nodes.py', line 405, in analyse_declarations: StatListNode(formats.pyx:7:0)
File 'Nodes.py', line 5475, in analyse_declarations: CClassDefNode(formats.pyx:7:0,
    as_name = 'Test',
    class_name = 'Test',
    decorators = [...]/1,
    module_name = '',
    punycode_class_name = 'Test',
    visibility = 'private')
File 'Nodes.py', line 5459, in _handle_cclass_decorators: CClassDefNode(formats.pyx:7:0,
    as_name = 'Test',
    class_name = 'Test',
    decorators = [...]/1,
    module_name = '',
    punycode_class_name = 'Test',
    visibility = 'private')

Compiler crash traceback from this point on:
  File "\venv12\Lib\site-packages\Cython\Compiler\Nodes.py", line 5459, in _handle_cclass_decorators
    kwds = kwds_.as_python_dict()
           ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
AttributeError: 'MergedDictNode' object has no attribute 'as_python_dict'
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "\cython_setup.py", line 35, in <module>
    ext_modules = cythonize([extension, con_extension, formats_extension], annotate=True)
                  ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "\venv12\Lib\site-packages\Cython\Build\Dependencies.py", line 1154, in cythonize
    cythonize_one(*args)
  File "\venv12\Lib\site-packages\Cython\Build\Dependencies.py", line 1298, in cythonize_one
    raise CompileError(None, pyx_file)
Cython.Compiler.Errors.CompileError: assimilation\formats.pyx

Process finished with exit code 1

```


### Code to reproduce the behaviour:

```cython
from __future__ import annotations

import dataclasses


dataclass_args = {"order": True, "slots": True, "unsafe_hash": True}
@dataclasses.dataclass(**dataclass_args)
cdef class Test():
    optional_text: str
```


### Expected behaviour

Except for the cdef this is valid python code, so I kind of expected it to work, or if it isn't supposed to work to give a meaningful error message, but instead Cython crashed internally.

### OS

Windows 10

### Python version

3.12.10

### Cython version

3.1.3

### Additional context

Converting a larger bunch of dataclasses to Cython to then benchmark, it would be nice if singular steps forward worked so I can have confidence the finished conversion also will work.

comment_data.body:
Arbitrary decorators don't generally work with cdef classes so I wouldn't expect this to work, but as you say it should give you an informative error and not a compiler crash. 

There is a `cython.dataclasses.dataclass` decorator that should work on cdef classes. That's (necessarily) more restrictive in some ways. And may have its own bugs of course

title: [BUG] AttributeError: 'MergedDictNode' object has no attribute 'as_python_dict'
